Sample¶

This is a class that holds all the samples information.

class defects.sample.Sample(**kwargs)[source]¶

This is a class that attempts to encapulate all the samples properties. One of the problems is that there is a lot of properties so this is a very large class

ni, vth_e, vth_h are all calculated values from theoretical models unless a value is provided.
Attributes:
Ef
Nacc

The concentration of acceptor dopant atoms

Ndon

The concentration of donor dopant atoms

Vt

The thermal voltage

defectlist
dopant_type

The sample’s dopant type

doping

The number of dopants.

ni

The sample’s intrinsic carrier density.

ni_eff

Currently not impimented and just returns the intrinsic carrier density.

temp

The sample temperature in kelvin

vth_e

The thermal velocity of an electron

vth_h

The thermal velocity of an electron

Methods

defectlist_removeDefect(number) Removes a single defect from the defect list
equlibrium_concentrations() Calculate the equlibrium carrier concentration
steady_state_concentraions(nxc) Calculate the steady state concentration of carriers, provided the number of excess minoirty carriers by peturbing the number of excess majority carriers.
Nacc¶

The concentration of acceptor dopant atoms

Ndon¶

The concentration of donor dopant atoms

Vt¶

The thermal voltage

defectlist_removeDefect(number)[source]¶

Removes a single defect from the defect list

dopant_type¶

The sample’s dopant type

it can be:
  1. ‘p’ or ‘p-type’ for p-type
  2. ‘n’ or ‘n-type’ for n-type
doping¶

The number of dopants. This is not the ionised dopants

equlibrium_concentrations()[source]¶

Calculate the equlibrium carrier concentration

Returns:
ne0 : float

the free electron concentration in the dark

nh0 : float

the free hole concentration in the dark
ni¶

The sample’s intrinsic carrier density. If this is not provided it will be calculated.

ni_eff¶

Currently not impimented and just returns the intrinsic carrier density.

steady_state_concentraions(nxc)[source]¶

Calculate the steady state concentration of carriers, provided the number of excess minoirty carriers by peturbing the number of excess majority carriers.

This assumes a constant intrinsic carrier density.

Parameters:
nxc : float

the number of excess carrier densities
Returns:
ne0 : float

the free electron concentration

nh0 : float

the free hole concentration
temp¶

The sample temperature in kelvin

vth_e¶

The thermal velocity of an electron

vth_h¶

The thermal velocity of an electron

simulation of defects in semiconductor
